intro: Trichoscypha braunii, commonly known as the African ivory nut, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, simple leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by round, woody fruits containing a single seed. Its seeds are encased in a hard, ivory-colored shell, which is the source of its common name. Trichoscypha braunii is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in some African communities.
